item.title: Scheduled downtime of Instant Bank Pay and Verified Mandates
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Maintenance

Summary: The company will be migrating some functionality from Amazon Web Services to Google Cloud Platform, causing a temporary unavailability of certain open banking capabilities for Account Information Services and Payment Initiation Services. No action is required, and the impact is expected to be minimal.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 28, 03:00 - 06:00 GMT

Feb 23, 11:02 GMT
Scheduled - On 28th February for 1 hour between 03:00-06:00 UTC, we will be migrating part of our functionality from Amazon Web Services to Google Cloud Platform. During this hour our open banking capabilities for Account Information Services and Payment Initiation Services will be unavailable. These power our Instant Bank Pay and Verified Mandates products.

This migration will strengthen our infrastructure by increasing efficiency, scalability and reliability. No action is required by any merchants using these products and our analysis suggests that we facilitate very few payments during this window. We appreciate your understanding during this time.

This activity was aimed to be completed on 20th February, however, an unforeseen issue arose. All changes were reverted and all systems were tested and operational within the maintenance window.

item.title: Scheduled downtime of Instant Bank Pay and Verified Mandates
item.content:encoded:
Completed, scheduled maintenance, migration, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform

The scheduled maintenance to migrate functionality from Amazon Web Services to Google Cloud Platform has been completed. During the 30-minute migration, open banking capabilities for Account Information Services and Payment Initiation Services were unavailable. This affected the Instant Bank Pay and Verified Mandates products. The purpose of the migration was to strengthen the infrastructure for increased efficiency, scalability, and reliability. No action was required from merchants using the products, and it was noted that very few payments were facilitated during the maintenance window. The company appreciates the understanding of its clients during this time.
Summary:

Feb 20, 05:00 GMT
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 20, 03:00 GMT
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 15, 14:58 GMT
Scheduled - For 30 minutes between 03:00-05:00 UTC, we will be migrating part of our functionality from Amazon Web Services to Google Cloud Platform. During these 30 minutes our open banking capabilities for Account Information Services and Payment Initiation Services will be unavailable. These power our Instant Bank Pay and Verified Mandates products.

This migration will strengthen our infrastructure to increase efficiency, scalability and reliability. No action is required by any merchants using these products and our analysis suggests that we facilitate very few payments during this window. We appreciate your understanding during this time.

item.title: API, Payment Pages and Dashboard Outage
item.content:encoded:
Investigating, Instant Bank Payments, delays, engineers, updates Summary: - Instant Bank Payments were delayed on February 18th between 2:30 pm and 3:40 pm. - The engineers are currently investigating the issue. - A resolution for the performance degradation has been identified and rectified. - The company is evaluating the impact and will proactively communicate with affected customers as necessary. - No additional disruption is expected.

Summary:

Feb 19, 19:33 GMT
Resolved - We have identified and rectified the root cause of the performance degradation. We are currently evaluating the impact and will proactively communicate with any affected customers as necessary.

Feb 19, 15:45 GMT
Investigating - We are currently experiencing delays on our Instant Bank Payments

Our engineers are investigating and we'll provide updates here.

Feb 19, 10:56 GMT
Monitoring - Instant Bank Payments were delayed on the 18th of February between 2:30 pm and 3:40 pm.

We do not expect any additional disruption.

item.title: Issues with IBP processing
item.content:encoded:
Feb 6, 19:53 GMT
Resolved - We have confirmed IBP payments are operating as expected.

Feb 6, 18:41 GMT
Monitoring - We have successfully implemented a fix and reprocessed payments stuck in the submitted state.

We will continue to monitor to ensure all is working as expected.

Feb 6, 17:40 GMT
Identified - We've identified the cause of the issue and are working on implementing the solution.

Feb 6, 14:27 GMT
Investigating - We have identified an issue with Instant Bank Payments across some UK banks.

Our engineering teams are identifying impacted payments and working on a solution.

item.title: Users with SMS MFA enabled unable to log in
item.content:encoded:
Jan 31, 08:49 GMT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 31, 08:17 GMT
Monitoring - Our engineers have implemented the fix and confirmed SMS messages are being sent again. Those with MFA enabled should now receive their messages again and be able to login.

We will continue to monitor to ensure there are no further issues.

Jan 31, 07:30 GMT
Investigating - There is an issue with a third party service which is preventing SMS messages for MFA being sent. This is causing merchants who have MFA enabled and who have selected SMS as the MFA method to receive a 503 error when trying to log in.
We are investigating the cause of this issue and have identified the problem. Engineers are working to resolve this as soon as possible.

item.title: Degraded dashboard performance
item.content:encoded:
Jan 25, 17:42 GMT
Resolved - We have confirmed the dashboard is operating as normal and the issue is resolved.

Jan 25, 16:52 GMT
Monitoring - We have implemented a fix and validated it is working but we will continue to monitor to ensure everything is working as expected.

Jan 25, 16:37 GMT
Identified - We have received reports of issues accessing our dashboard. We have identified the issue and we will be deploying a fix shortly.

item.title: Scheduled downtime of identity verification partner
item.content:encoded:
Dec 17, 05:00 GMT
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Dec 17, 03:30 GMT
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 13, 15:25 GMT
Scheduled - Between 3.30am and 5.00am UTC on 17th December, customers will be unable to upload identify documents for verification due to scheduled downtime for system upgrades from our identify verification partner.
We apologies for any inconvenience this may cause but please note that all other steps of the onboarding process will still be available.

item.title: Degraded performance
item.content:encoded:
Nov 14, 13:31 GMT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 14, 12:38 GMT
Monitoring - The issue has now been fixed. Performance is back to normal levels.

Nov 14, 11:53 GMT
Identified - Our engineers have identified the cause of the slow performance on the API and dashboard. A fix is in progress.

Nov 14, 11:29 GMT
Investigating - We are experiencing degraded performance on our API and dashboard. Our engineers are investigating the issue.

item.title: Degraded API & Dashboard Performance
item.content:encoded:
Nov 3, 13:44 GMT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 3, 12:18 GMT
Monitoring - We've resolved the root cause of the degraded performance. We'll continue to monitor API and Dashboard performance.

Nov 3, 11:46 GMT
Identified - We've identified the cause of the degraded performance. We're currently rolling out a fix.

Nov 3, 11:41 GMT
Investigating - We've spotted that something has gone wrong. We're currently investigating the issue, and will provide an update soon.

item.title: Notification of payouts not sent
item.content:encoded:
Oct 31, 18:58 GMT
Resolved - All events have now been processed and we have validated that all payments have now been marked as confirmed.

Oct 31, 17:58 GMT
Monitoring - Following the fix, webhooks are starting to come through, although it may take longer for larger payouts. Payouts in the dashboard are also starting to be marked as paid.

We continue to monitor until all are marked as paid.

Oct 31, 17:36 GMT
Identified - We believe we have identified the issue and we are implementing a fix to mark the payments as confirmed.

Oct 31, 17:08 GMT
Investigating - We are investigating an issue that merchants have not been notified of payouts being paid. We have validated that payments have been sent and it is just the confirmation of the payment that is impacted.

We will provide another update shortly.

item.title: Delayed webhooks in sandbox
item.content:encoded:
Oct 19, 17:47 BST
Resolved - Webhooks in sandbox are now being delivered promptly again.
We've also put in place mitigations to prevent the root cause of this incident from reoccurring.

Oct 19, 12:35 BST
Identified - We're seeing delays in delivering webhooks in sandbox. We've identified the cause and working on a fix.

Production is not affected.

item.title: Breakdown of payments not visible in dashboard
item.content:encoded:
Oct 18, 21:23 BST
Resolved - The issue has been resolved and breakdowns are now visible in the dashboard for all merchants.

Oct 18, 19:31 BST
Identified - We have identified an issue that is affecting some merchants being able to see their payout breakdown in their dashboard. Please be reassured that payouts have been sent, it is just seeing the breakdown in the dashboard that is impacted.

Our engineers our working on a fix and hope to have this resolved soon. In the meantime, exporting transactions will still shown the breakdown.

item.title: Some webhooks being dispatched with invalid metadata
item.content:encoded:
Oct 4, 18:12 BST
Resolved - Between 13:53UTC and 15:33UTC we sent a small number of malformed webhooks to "app" integrators.

These webhooks contained events missing "organisation" in the "links" field.

These events had previously been delivered to integrators in webhooks with "organisation" correctly set.

Oct 4, 17:22 BST
Identified - We've spotted that something has gone wrong.

We're currently investigating the issue, and will provide an update to affected integrators soon.

Oct 4, 16:55 BST
Investigating - We've had reports of issues with GoCardless webhooks.

Our engineers are investigating and we'll provide updates here.

item.title: API degraded performance (sandbox & live)
item.content:encoded:
Sep 21, 17:30 BST
Resolved - Between 5:30 PM and 7:00 PM this evening, we experienced degraded performance on our API in both live and sandbox environments. Some requests will have returned 5xx HTTP response codes. Please retry your requests if you faced any such errors.

item.title: Webhooks are not being delivered
item.content:encoded:
Sep 15, 16:11 BST
Resolved - The issue has been resolved. Our monitoring shows that our Webhooks and Customer Notifications services have stayed stable following the fix we applied.

We have now successfully processed and dispatch all events

Sep 15, 12:31 BST
Update - Our engineers have applied a fix and we are once again processing Webhooks and Customer Notifications.

We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Sep 15, 12:23 BST
Monitoring - Our engineers have applied a fix and we are once again processing Webhooks and Customer Notifications.

We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Sep 15, 11:20 BST
Identified - Webhooks, and Customer Notifications, are currently not being delivered.

We've identified the root cause and are working on rolling out a fix.

item.title: Dashboard and payment pages not loading on Google Chrome v117
item.content:encoded:
Sep 14, 10:10 BST
Resolved - We haven't observed any loading issues since the fix was applied.

We do not expect any additional disruption.

Sep 13, 15:57 BST
Monitoring - Our engineers have applied a fix and all pages are now loading successfully.

We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Sep 13, 14:16 BST
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an outage of our Dashboard and Payment Pages while using the newest version of Google Chrome.

Our engineers have found the root cause and are working towards a solution, if you encounter a page-loading problem, please use another browser as a workaround.

item.title: Partial Dashboard Outage
item.content:encoded:
Aug 18, 18:23 BST
Resolved - Our monitoring shows that our dashboard pages have stayed stable following the fix we applied.

We are confident that this issue has been resolved.

Aug 18, 16:33 BST
Monitoring - Our engineers have applied a fix and access to all dashboard pages should available again.

We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Aug 18, 15:10 BST
Investigating - We are currently investigating a partial outage in our dashboard and we will be providing a further update shortly

item.title: API, Payment Pages and Dashboard Outage
item.content:encoded:
Aug 14, 17:23 BST
Resolved - Our monitoring shows that our services have stayed stable following the fix we applied.

We do not expect any additional disruption.

Aug 14, 16:50 BST
Monitoring - Our engineers have applied a fix and we are once again serving API, dashboard, and payment page traffic.

We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Aug 14, 16:40 BST
Identified - Our engineers have identified the issue causing a partial outage and are working to apply a fix.

item.title: Slow logins on dashboard
item.content:encoded:
Jul 29, 16:07 BST
Resolved - Incident has been resolved.

Jul 29, 12:34 BST
Monitoring - The dashboard logins are back to normal. Our engineers will continue to investigate to identify the root cause.

Jul 29, 11:53 BST
Investigating - We are currently experiencing slow logins on our dashboard. Our engineers are investigating and we'll provide updates here.

item.title: API Degraded Performance
item.content:encoded:
Jul 28, 12:04 BST
Resolved - We identified and addressed the cause of the degraded API performance.

We do not expect any additional disruption.

Jul 28, 11:55 BST
Investigating - We've observed an increase in latency across many API endpoints.

API and Dashboard users may be experiencing degraded performance. We're investigating the cause and will post another update shortly.

item.title: Error while setting up mandates from mobile devices
item.content:encoded:
Jul 25, 10:07 BST
Resolved - The issue has been is resolved. If you still encounter the error, please refresh the page to ensure the fix is applied.

Jul 24, 15:05 BST
Monitoring - We've identified an issue where adding bank details to confirm the mandate creation on mobile devices returned an error.
Our engineers found the root cause and reverted the change causing the issue, we're monitoring the situation.

item.title: Partial outage of integration webhooks
item.content:encoded:
Jul 24, 16:54 BST
Resolved - The issue has been resolved. Our monitoring shows that webhooks have been stable since yesterday. We have successfully resubmitted all missed events.

Jul 23, 19:48 BST
Update - The replay of missed events is now complete. We will conduct some checks to verify that it ran correctly.

Jul 23, 19:04 BST
Monitoring - We kicked off a replay of missed events. This started around 17:00 UTC (18:00 BST). Integrator webhooks are now getting invoked with events starting from Friday when the incident began.

Jul 23, 11:43 BST
Update - The issue has been fixed. Webhooks are now operational. New event notifications are getting delivered via webhooks. We are working on replaying/resubmitting all missed events since the incident began on Friday.

Jul 23, 09:36 BST
Identified - We experienced an issue where roughly 3/4 of webhook notifications were not delivered since Friday afternoon. The cause of the issue has been identified. A fix in progress.

Jul 23, 02:30 BST
Update - Our engineers are still investigating the issue. A large number of webhook notifications are still not getting sent.

All other components are operational. Payments and mandates are unaffected by this incident. Events can still be queried via the API.

Jul 23, 01:04 BST
Update - We are continuing to investigate. The issue started on Friday 21 July around 13:30 UTC.

Jul 23, 00:25 BST
Investigating - We are experiencing issues with our integration webhooks. Our engineers are investigating the problem.

item.title: API TLS certificate authority change (No action required)
item.content:encoded:
Jul 18, 11:42 BST
Completed - The change has been rolled out successfully. The API endpoint (api.gocardless.com) is now using the new TLS certificate.

Jul 18, 11:00 BST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jul 4, 10:32 BST
Scheduled - From Tuesday 18th July 2023, GoCardless will begin transitioning the api.gocardless.com endpoint to a new TLS certificate.

This change will be transparent and therefore not result in any interruption of service, as long as your GoCardless integration does not perform any certificate "pinning". Pinning is not a supported configuration, as per: https://developer.gocardless.com/api-reference#appendix-public-certificate-policy

The new chain of trust will begin with the following root certificate authority: 'GlobalSign nv-sa': https://valid.r1.roots.globalsign.com/ https://crt.sh/?id=88. This root CA has been distributed for 20+ years, but if you have concerns about your systems' ability to verify this chain then you must ensure that your configuration is updated.

Email communications have also been sent out to all integrators who could be affected by this change.

item.title: Some payout details are currently not visible
item.content:encoded:
Jun 29, 09:02 BST
Resolved - Incident has been resolved.

Jun 28, 16:55 BST
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an issue where items included in a payout may not be visible on the dashboard or via the API.
Our engineering team is currently investigating the issue.

item.title: Internal status update posted publicly
item.content:encoded:
Jun 15, 20:25 BST
Resolved - We apologise for publishing an internal status update to the public status page. This is an issue that has been resolved and we do not expect any disruption to any services.

No customer or merchant information was included in the update, all information was internal reference IDs only. For more information, please contact our support team via help@gocardless.com.

item.title: Delayed webhooks
item.content:encoded:
Jun 13, 14:55 BST
Resolved - On the 30th of May, as part of our efforts to scale our web hook delivery infrastructure we rolled out a changed that caused delays to webhooks.

We rolled back the change, and over the subsequent days, have made additional changes to improve the throughput of the system.

We have also introduced more alerting as part of our ongoing scalability efforts.

Jun 2, 12:34 BST
Monitoring - Our engineers have put a mitigation in place. We are once again processing webhooks in a timely manner.

We will continue to monitor the health and performance of the affected components.

Jun 2, 11:43 BST
Investigating - We are experiencing delays in webhook delivery again in both live and sandbox environments. Our engineers are working on the issue.

Jun 1, 16:26 BST
Monitoring - Our engineers have identified the issue and applied a fix. We are once again processing webhooks in a timely manner.

We are continuing to monitor the situation.

Jun 1, 13:37 BST
Update - We are currently experiencing a significant delay in webhook delivery across both live and sandbox environments. Our engineers are investigating the issue.

Jun 1, 13:36 BST
Investigating - We are currently experiencing a significant delay in webhook delivery across both live and sandbox environments. Our engineers are investigating the issue.
